channel.title: Blood on the Forums VI: Monsta Jam (Rerolled due to integrity breach)
channel.description:
The Penance Day celebration was in full swing. The tavern was alive with celebration, and the drinks flowed like water.
“’Bout time we got a break from nightmarish demonic invasions!”
“My dear old grandma got emboweled by that horrid thing. I could use another drink.”
“Hang on, I’ll go find the barkeep. Amelia! Keep it flowin’, we’re—*GODS!*”
Amelia was a bit of a legend in town, having brewed a vintage so potent it knocked out the last demon to invade. But the town’s last savior had met a fate… not unlike the other saviors, actually; in a pool of blood, with the air around noticeably heavy with dark energies.
“Check, please!” The townsfolk all turned to see none other than the infamous specter of Tangeld sitting at a booth, swirling a flute of champagne.
“No, no, no… You get out of here, you wicked wraith! This is a celebration! You only show up when—”
“When a demon murders someone? Yeah, I noticed. You really didn’t think that the minions of evil were gonna let you put your feet up and relax, did you? Nah, they were so damn determined to put this party on ice that they didn’t even bother with the full summoning ritual. They’ve just got this tiny little thing, but damn is it vicious. Ask the missing bits of Amelia’s throat. Which reminds me, Amelia, you need a drink?”
Amelia’s ghost drifted into the other side of Tan’s booth. “I’m gonna need something stronger than what you’ve got. No idea how you kept it together so well after you died.”
“You assume that I had it together to begin with. And as for the rest of you… get hunting. I’m sure a baby demon isn’t gonna give you too much trouble, right?”
# Day 1 has begun! Nominations will open in twelve hours. [details=”Character List”] Townsfolk: [color=29b6f6]**Chef**[/color]: You start the game knowing how many instances of adjacent evil players exist. [color=29b6f6]**Investigator**[/color]: You start knowing that one of two players is a particular Minion. [color=29b6f6]**Bounty Hunter**[/color]: You start the game knowing one evil player. When the evil player you know dies, you learn another that night. [One Townsfolk is evil] [color=29b6f6]**Sailor**[/color]: Each day, choose a living player; either they malfunction until dusk, or you do. You cannot die. (You act on the first night as well.) [color=29b6f6]**Preacher**[/color]: Each night, choose a player. If you choose a Minion, they learn that the Preacher chose them (but not who you are), and they have no ability. [color=29b6f6]**Cult Leader**[/color]: Each night, you become the alignment of one of your living neighbors (but your character is unchanged). Once per day, you may attempt to start a cult; if all good players join your cult on the same day, your alignment wins. [color=29b6f6]**Town Crier**[/color]: Each night, you learn if a Minion player nominated the previous day. [color=29b6f6]**Gambler**[/color]: Each night (but not the first), choose a player and guess their character. If you guess wrong, you die. [color=29b6f6]**Exorcist**[/color]: Each night (but not the first), choose a player (you may not choose the same player two nights in a row); If you choose the Demon, they do not act tonight, but they learn who you are. [color=29b6f6]**Philosopher**[/color]: Once per game, at night, choose a good character; You gain their ability. If you choose a character that is already in play, that player malfunctions until you die or change character. [color=29b6f6]**Soldier**[/color]: You are safe from the Demon’s attacks. [color=29b6f6]**Fool**[/color]: The first time you would die, you do not die. [color=29b6f6]**Mayor**[/color]: If you are killed at night, another player might die instead. If there is no execution when only three players remain, good wins.
Outsiders: [color=29b6f6]**Drunk**[/color]: You think you are a Townsfolk character, but the ability that you think you have instead malfunctions. [color=29b6f6]**Barber**[/color]: If you die, the Demon, in addition to their kill, may choose two players tonight; these two players swap characters. This ability may not target dead Demons. [color=29b6f6]**Politician**[/color]: If you were the player most responsible for your alignment losing, you change alignment and win, even if dead. [color=29b6f6]**Saint**[/color]: If you are executed, your alignment loses.
Minions: [color=red]**Spy**[/color]:You might register as good and as a Townsfolk or Outsider, even if dead, and you may view the Grimoire each night. [color=red]**Witch**[/color]: Each night, choose a player; if that player nominates tomorrow, they die immediately (but their nomination stands). If only three players are alive, this ability does not function. [color=red]**Assassin**[/color]: Once per game, at night (but not the first), choose a player; they die immediately, even if they normally would not die. [color=red]**Baron**[/color]: There are more Outsiders in play. [+2 Outsiders]
Demon: [color=red]**Lil’ Monsta**[/color]: Each night, the Minions choose who babysits the Lil’ Monsta; that player “is the Demon”. Each night (but not the first), a player dies. [+1 Minion] [/details]
# Players: 1. EliThePsycho 2. Canteloupe 3. Apprentice 4. Gorta 5. Intensify 6. Marshal 7. Marluxion 8. PKR 9. Nightingale 10. Clonedcheese 11. Pigeon (soon to be Arctic)
Backups: 1. Kat-zuh 2. Datbird 3. Windward 4. Wazza
Spectators (spectator chat coming soon, just let me make this thread pretty): 1. Shurian 2. YoubutWorse 3. min 4. Pug 5. Novali 6. Icibalus 7. Nerbins 8. Arete 9. Light

item.title: Blood on the Forums VI: Monsta Jam (Rerolled due to integrity breach)
item.dc:creator: Tangeld
item.description:
As the townsfolk deliberated, Tan and Amelia sat at the booth playing cards. Without warning, the entire building shook violently. Tan’s drink spilled.

“Aw, hell, was that a breach? Felt like a breach.”

“Think there’s any chance they didn’t notice?” Tan and Amelia turned to the townsfolk to see them all staring back, eyes wide with evident fright. “Nope, they noticed… Damnit, Amelia, I swear this happens everywhere you go.”

“Oh, don’t you pin this on me!”

“So now what do we do?”

“…Tan, you’ve pulled time travel shenanigans in every one of these damn games. You’re really telling me you don’t have any idea what to do here?”

“I didn’t time travel in Moonlight. Time travel doesn’t even help here, we just run right back into the same breach?”

“…Jump to another universe, then?”

“We can only do that a couple more times, you know.”

“Kinda have to.”

“Wait, you’ve done this before?!” Eli cried out.

“Sure have. This is like… the fourth one? I’ll be honest, I might be forgetting one in the middle. Alright, let’s try this again.” Tan snapped her fingers and the world went white.

Just one game without an integrity breach… That’s all Amelia asks. And you ruined my unbreached streak!

Time for a reset! Hosts are gonna rebuild gamecomp, redistribute rolls and we’re gonna start fresh from the opening of a new D1. At least we got it out of our systems early… glares at no one in particular Isn’t that right?

Read full topic
